fr:tree.fr:mainmatter: Let P=P(\psi _1,\psi _2) (). A \natural -structure on P is, first of all, a connection on the trivial \mathbb {G}_\mathrm {m}-torsor over V_\mathbb {C}\times W_\mathbb {C}, i.e. a field of forms \Gamma _{v,w}(v'+w') on V_\mathbb {C}\times W_\mathbb {C}. This connection defines a \natural -structure on this torsor if and only if \Gamma _{v,w}(v'+w') = \Phi _1(v,w') + \Phi _2(v',w) with \Phi _1 and \Phi _2 bilinear. The trivialisations \exp \psi _1(v_\mathbb {Z},w_\mathbb {C}) and \exp \psi _2(v_\mathbb {C},w_\mathbb {Z}) are horizontal if and only if \Phi _i=-\psi _i. The curvature of the connection is the field of 2-forms \mathrm {d}\Gamma : R_{v,w}(v'+w',v''+w'') = \Phi _1(v',w'') + \Phi _2(v'',w') - \Phi _1(v'',w') - \Phi _2(v',w''). The curvature of P is thus of the form \Phi _1(v',w'') - \Phi _2(v',w'') = -(\psi _1(v',w'') - \psi _2(v',w'')) = -\psi (v',w'').

fr:mainmatter.fr:p: Let V_\mathbb {Z} and W_\mathbb {Z} be two free \mathbb {Z}-modules of finite rank, and P a biextension of [V_\mathbb {Z}\to V_\mathbb {C}] and [W_\mathbb {Z}\to W_\mathbb {C}] by \mathbb {G}_\mathrm {m} with underlying biextension P. Then the curvature \psi \colon V_\mathrm {c}\otimes W_\mathbb {C}\to \mathbb {C} of P^\natural agrees with the negative of the complexification of the form corresponding to P under .
